summary: Tested hierarchical traffic light system for navigation sections. All features working correctly: Backend endpoint returns status for all sections (step1-5, foundations, infostructure), parent status aggregation works (worst of children), Coming Soon items display gray status, and UI displays colored dots (green/yellow/red/gray) next to navigation items.
passed_tests: Backend: All step sections (step1-5) have traffic light status
Backend: Foundations section has traffic light status with subsections (foundations-who-bp, foundations-who-companies, foundations-what, foundations-how, foundations-howmuch)
Backend: Infostructure section has traffic light status with subsections (pharma, med-societies, med-specialties, keywords, sources)
Backend: Step1 parent aggregation works - reflects worst status from 1.1, 1.2, 1.3
Backend: Coming Soon items (1.2.1-1.2.4, 1.3.4, 2.1.2, 5.2, 1.1.2) have gray status with reason='coming_soon'
Backend: LinkedIn finders (1.1.1.1, 1.1.1.2, 1.1.1.3) have progress data (contacts_this_week, goal=50, progress)
Backend: Via LinkedIn parent (1.1.1) has breakdown data and goal=150
Backend: All status values are valid (green, yellow, red, gray)
Backend: Foundations parent aggregation works correctly
Backend: Infostructure parent aggregation works correctly
Backend: Endpoint requires authentication (returns 401 without token)
Frontend: Traffic light dots displayed in navigation sidebar
Frontend: Green dots for items on track (1.1.1.1 By Molecules, 1.1.1.2 By Post)
Frontend: Red dot for 1.1.1.3 By Position (0 contacts this week)
Frontend: Gray dot for Coming Soon items (5.2 Students for Recommendations, 1.1.2 Via Google Maps)
Frontend: Yellow dots for parent sections with mixed children status
Frontend: Traffic light refreshes every 2 minutes
context_for_next_testing_agent: Hierarchical traffic light system is fully implemented and working. Backend calculates statuses for all navigation sections and aggregates parent statuses (red > yellow > green, gray ignored). Frontend displays colored dots (green/yellow/red/gray) next to each navigation item. Current week data: 1.1.1.1 Molecules=235 (green), 1.1.1.2 Posts=473 (green), 1.1.1.3 Position=0 (red). Coming Soon items correctly show gray status.

parent_aggregation.logic: Parent = worst of children (red > yellow > green), gray children ignored
